reviewText: PEE-YOOOO! This fim is NOT funny AT ALL (well, maybe the scene with Richard Mulligan disguised as a mummy will make you chuckle a little). These are some of the most unappealing, unlikeable characters under the sun (Richard Masur's charachter in particular is not to be watched before eating). About the only thing remotely appealing about this movie is the theme song by the late great Scat Man Crothers over the end titles. Other than than that, this malodorous bomb will stink up your VCR! Use the DVD for skeet shooting.

reviewText: If you ever went on a scavenger hunt when you were a kid and wondered what it would be like to do so as an adult, this movie will answer that question while making you laugh. The cast is great, the plot is great (relatives, friends and staff of a games magnet leaves his fortune to whoever wins a scavenger hunt), the characters are great, made when Hollywood did not make it a requirement that all movies had to be vulgar. SO WHERE'S THE DVD VERSION??
Title: N/A

reviewText: Oh my God that is the best movie ever made. Vencent Price was a great comedian in the opening scenes. The "last and least" quote from his will got me started with the giggles. All of his heirs were a bunch of comedian stars. When they had to steal cash registers,stuffed animals,toilets, Indian's dentures, bee hives rubber rafts,car bumpers,and other hillarious odd objects I lost it.  The part when all the heirs tried to leave the mansion when the game started was histarical. There was many guest stars that helped this movie get more funnier than ever. The way the heirs stole the objects from other people and other places caused me to laugh and cry. The car chases are the best, much better and longer than the ones on the Blues Brothers. No this movie does not look low bugeted to me. This movie is also made for those who are fans of 1967,1968,and,1969 caddilacs Those cars show up everywhere during the movie. Sorry Midnight Madness you come in second next to Scavenger Hunt. I hope I can order this movie from Amazon.com without any problems.
summary: I had to pause the movie and run to the bathroom many times!

reviewText: This movie will probably never get a DVD release because frankly it is a little dated.  The outfits, cars, and even the unspoiled countryside minutes from down town San Diego.  To say nothing of the beloved 60s and 70s stars.  Outside of rocker Meatloaf, Chloris Leachman and Arnold Schwarzenegger the younger viewer would be hard pressed to recognize most of the cast.For those old enough to remember the stars, sentimentality's sake deserves a watch, for everyone else this movie makes Three's Company look like Ibsen.  A wealthy toy magnate Milton Parker (get it?) dies and leaves his fortune to the winner of a scavenger hunt.  At which point all logic flies away as we watch some unbelievable slapstick, pricelessly bad dialog watching the stars practically kill each other for the money.Sound bad?  No way it is a scream!  Car chases, some good singing by the great Scatman Crothers and stunt cameos make it a hilarious way to spend a rainy afternoon.  See it!

reviewText: Like many people that have reviewed Scavenger Hunt, I'll add that I've also been looking for this movie on DVD for almost a decade now. I just don't get why it hasn't been released on DVD. One of the funnier movies I've ever seen, admittedly a really stupid kind of humor. One kids and adults can both watch and would probably enjoy. I think I'll send an email to Fox Home Entertainment and ask if there are any plans to release this in the near future. If not, I'll let them know that there are others also interested in getting this gem on DVD.

reviewText: non-stop laughter during this movie. This movie has NEVER been released on DVD in any county. People selling this on DVD are selling bootleg DVD copies of the VHS tape. Totally illegal and unethical. If you buy a dvd of this movie, the quality will be VHS, which is crap. Even if a seller tells you this is a korean import, beware, it IS a bootleg and probably not from Korea either. Movie is great, fake dvd's are not cool.

reviewText: This movie has an all star cast and is outstanding.  I do agree with just about everyone who has posted their review on here it SHOULD be on DVD.  A very rich millionaire puts together a scavenger hunt in the efforts to get a fortune that he leaves if they win the race.  Richard Benjamin, Cloris Leachman, and Richard Masur end up as one team, Willie Ames (Eight Is Enough), Dirk Benedict (A-Team) and a girl they have join them is another team, Avery Schriver I think is his name makes a cameo appearance who was the former spokesperson for Frito Lay's Doritos commercials.  English actor Robert Morley, the late Scatman Corruthers, and the late Richard Mulligan (Empty Nest).  Most of these actors that are in this ARE LATE.  The late Roddy McDowall, the late Clevon Little (Blazing Saddles) the late James Coco just to name a few.  Even Tony Randall is in this.  And believe it or not, the governor of California himself ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGAR makes a cameo in this.  When it comes to the part of where Tony Randall was getting a medicine ball for his scavenger hunt list, he comes to this workout gym where Schwarzenaggar is, and he throws it to Randall, and it crashes out the window.  And they kidnap five ostriches for their contest.  Also the funny part is when the servants team (Little, Coco, McDowall and some maid with a french accent) steal a toilet from a hotel and it shatters into thousands of pieces.  I hope FOX HOME VIDEO puts this classic out on DVD cause I would definitely buy it!!!!
summary: Much like It's A Mad Mad Mad World

reviewText: This is an exceptionally funny film that has always been way under-rated.The acting and directing are good, and the comedic timing is excellent.The plot, as in any good fast paced comedy, is simple. A wealthy old man decides to have a bit of fun and a bit of revenge on thosewho hope to inherit his millions. The terms of the will state that there will be a scavenger hunt. No rules about how the itemsare aquired, just get em by the deadline. Winner take all.This situation could make a good comedy even with normal people/characters. But the characters in this movie are far from normal.They are nutty to just insane to start with even before getting a sniff of the possible big bucks.Most of them operate on the principle of "If you are dumb enough, you can do anything." And some of the gags are very original.If you have never imagined (and what sane person would imagine it) a group of idiots stealing a toilet from a high class hotel,grab some popcorn, sit back and let them show you exactly how it`s done.

reviewText: Looking for a clean, remastered, widescreen DVD edition of this enjoyable flick. Chock full of marvelous comedic performances -- Roddy McDowall (priceless in the loo), Tony Randall (in the gym...with Arnold), Richard Mulligan (in mummy garb), Stuart Pankin (in a checked shirt), and Avery Schreiber (at the zoo). And so many other treasured funny moments. Can't wait to ride along again with Dirk Benedict and Willie Aames.

reviewText: Movies like this aren't made anymore.  Can you imagine TomCruise or Angelina Jolie making (or being in) a film like Scavenger Hunt?  Though a lot of big stars (at the time) are in this movie, it's not a serious movie, nor is it meant to be.  In fact, that's the beauty of this movie.  I could describe the plot, etc. in detail (I've seen it at least 50 times), but suffice it to say that on a warm, summer day in 1979 (in San Diego), a diverse group of people set out to win $200 million dollars by taking part in a scavenger hunt.  This movie is dumb, most of the acting is amateur or 'phoned in', and the action is near nonexistent until the end.  But, again, if you like this kind of movie, you're in no hurry to see the movie end.  You like the characters because they try so hard to make the best of a thin script and contrived action and humor.  I'm a fan of what I call 'C' movies.  Movies that were intended to be good (someone thought so at some point), but really aren't in the 'normal' sense.  These types of movies differ from 'B' movies in that they're not niche, genre, etc. type movies that will appeal to a specific cult audience (such as "Evil Dead" or "Repo Man"), but movies that, for lack of a better way to put it, failed.  But, only at the box office.  These types of movies don't make any money, but in the long run, fans of them don't care.  Like "Midnight Madness", "Scavenger Hunt" is very much a movie of its time, i.e. the late 70s.  This was a laid back time in the U.S.A., and movies like this 'slipped' out of major studios from time to time.  Studios don't allow things like that to happen anymore.  Enjoy this movie in the spirit of 'beautiful accidents', and you may discover something that you won't find in any of today's movies.  I'd sure like to askArnold about this movie...
summary: A Very Different Kind of Fun

reviewText: I remember seeing this in the theater while in High School.  The whole movie is a laugh out loud riot.  They don't make them like this anymore.  Full of great comedic actors from 1979.  Rare appearances from Ruth Gordon, Vincent Price, and many others add to the fun.  Cloris Leachman has her funniest role since Young Frankenstein.  Like the other reviews, I too am suprised this classic comedy has never been released on DVD.  This has caused the few VHS copies left to become quite expensive, and that's if you can even find it avaliable on VHS.  It can only be purchased used right now.  I highly recommend the movie, but you'll need some luck finding a copy of it anywhere.
summary: Much like "It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World".
Title: N/A

reviewText: The synopsis of the movie: An eccentric toy company magnate (voice of Vincent Price)dies and wills his estate to the winner(s) of a strange Scavenger Hunt.  The family members and servants form teams to obtain odd things like an ostrich, an authentic suit of armor and the "worlds fattest man" each of which is worth a number of points. The movie is very amusing and great for children and adults.I find it perplexing that they (whoever "they" is!) will not release this classic on DVD.  Most of the humor is not side-splitting, but not vulgar either.  In fact, most if it's downright corny, but it's a good movie when youre in the mood for something not complicated. Judging from all the commmentary on this page, it seems to have a huge "cult" fan base! I keep thinking that "they" could make a boatload of money if they did rerelease it.I also wish they would release this on DVD so I could share it with my kids. Furthermore, I find it perplexing that no one has released it yet since some of the biggest names in the 70's show up in this movie. Among these are: Richard Benjamin, Dirk Benedict, Cloris Leachman, Tony Randall - to name a few.I have looked for the rerelease of this movie for about 8 years on Amazon.  I'm starting to think there's a conspiracy.  Maybe one of those "korean copies" will do...  nyah
summary: Why no rerelease of this sweet family movie?
Title: N/A
